content:
• Tuesday, July 30, 2013
  • GNW

    Genworth earnings an excuse to lighten up

    • Genworth (NYSE:GNW) book value per share of $29.76 is off from $32.90 at the end of Q1; excluding AOCI (gains/losses on portfolio), book value of $23.39 vs. $23.11.
    • U.S. life insurance operating profit of $79M vs. $64M a year ago, but off from $85M in Q1 as sales of life insurance products unexpectedly fell. "The company will continue to make pricing and product changes that would be expected to increase sales over time."
    • International mortgage insurance profit of $89M vs. $76M.
    • U.S. mortgage insurance profit of $13M vs. loss of $25M.
    • Net operating profit of $133M up 98.5% Y/Y.
    • The holding company ends quarter with about $1B in cash and liquid securities, up about $50M from Q1.
    • Earnings call tomorrow at 7:30 ET.
    • Shares -4.9% AH after a near-tripling over the past year.
    • Previous: Earnings report. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 PM
  • ANAD

    Anadigics -5.9% AH following Q2 beat, in-line guidance

    • Anadigics' (NASDAQ:ANAD) Q3 revenue is expected to be up 5%-8% Q/Q. That implies revenue of $36.3M-$37.4M, in-line with a $36.7M consensus.
    • Investors may have wanted more in light of the strong Q2 revenue beat, which was fueled by a continued surge in Wi-Fi front-end chip (FEIC) sales.
    • Wi-Fi FEIC sales, aided by a Galaxy S4 design win, rose 138% Q/Q to $11.4M in Q2, and made up 33% of revenue. They totaled just $1.1M back in Q4.
    • Total revenue +31% Q/Q and +38% Y/Y; opex -11% Y/Y.
    • Even after excluding stock compensation expenses and a $1.2M cost of sales charge, gross margin was only 5.5%, though that's an improvement from the negative margin posted in recent quarters.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • NANO

    More on Nanometrics earnings

    • Nanometrics (NASDAQ:NANO) Q2 beats across the board, but total sales declined by 35% Y/Y.
    • Gross margin was 41.9% compared to 42.7% in the prior quarter and 46.6% in the year-ago period.
    • Looking forward, the company sees Q3 coming in between $36M - $40M, below Street estimates for $46.4M. Non-GAAP losses are expected to be around $0.14 to $0.03, also below consensus for a $0.04 gain.
    • Shares -8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM
  • HBI

    More on Hanesbrands earnings

    • Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI) Q2 comes up shy on revenue but beats on a per share basis as total sales increased by 1.6% Y/Y.
    • Net earnings soared as higher sales and lower costs generated record profit margins.
    • Gross margin widened to 36.3% from 31.1%.
    • The company boosted 2013 earnings guidance, now expecting an EPS between $3.50 and $3.65 compared to its prior outlook for $3.25 to $ 3.40 per share.
    • The company also slightly lowered its revenue outlook, calling for sales of around $4.55B compared to its prior forecast for about $4.6B in revenue.
    • Shares +2.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM
  • OPTR

    Optimer beats by $0.07, misses on revenue

    • Optimer (NASDAQ:OPTR): Q2 EPS of -$0.55 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $20.1M misses by $1.21M. Shares -8.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM

  • After-hours top gainers / losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TSRX +18%. QCOR +14%. BEAT +10%. NVDQ +7%. SIMG +6%.
      Top losers: JIVE -18%. RVBD -15%. BGFV -12%. OPTR -9%. ANAD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • BGFV

    Big 5 Sports beats by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • Big 5 Sports (NASDAQ:BGFV): Q2 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $239.9M misses by $3.57M. Shares -11.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • MNK

    More on Questcor earnings

    • Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) Q2 beats on all fronts as net sales an EPS ramp higher versus the prior year period.
    • Net sales were up 64%, driven by the expanded usage of Acthar Gel, an increase in prescriptions by nephrologists in the treatment of nephrotic syndrome and by neurologists in the treatment of multiple sclerosis relapses and infantile spasms.
    • 7,050 vials of Acthar were shipped over the quarter, +50% Y/Y.
    • Total shipments +35%, with Rheumatology its largest growth contributor.
    • Shares +13.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image Q3 guidance in-line, new $50M buyback announced

    • The chipmaker expects Q3 revenue of $78M-$81M, in-line with an $80.1M consensus.
    • Q3 gross margin is expected to total 56%-57%, down slightly from Q2's 58%.
    • Strong demand for Silicon Image's MHL mobile video transmitter chips continue to drive growth.
    • Available buyback funds now stand at $60.3M (good for repurchasing 14% of shares at current levels).
    • SIMG +5.1% AH
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • INVN

    InvenSense beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • InvenSense (NYSE:INVN): FQ1 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $55.9M beats by $1.47M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 7 Comments
  • CBI

    More on Chicago Bridge & Iron earnings

    • Chicago Bridge & Iron (NYSE:CBI) Q2 beats across the board.
    • Net earnings rose 47% as revenue more than doubled.
    • Project engineering, construction and maintenance business reported revenue more than doubled to $1.66B.
    • New awards rose 37% to $2.5B, while its backlog totaled $24.5B.
    • Gross margin narrowed to 10.4% from 12.2%.
    • Shares -1.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGI

    More on Renewable Energy's Q2 results

    • Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:REGI) can thank its 60% rise in Q2 earnings to sharply higher prices on U.S. renewable fuel credits: RINs for the biomass-based diesel made by REG rose to $1.07 at the end of Q2 from $0.77 at the beginning of the quarter.
    • CEO Daniel Oh expects volumes in the biomass-based diesel component of RFS 2 to increase next year.
    • Shares +2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • JIVE

    Jive guidance light, shares -12% AH; is competition an issue?

    • Though JIVE's Q2 results beat estimates, Q3 guidance is for revenue of $36M-$37M and EPS of -$0.14 to -$0.16, mostly below a consensus of $38.2M and -$0.14.
    • Likewise, 2013 guidance is for revenue of $144M-$146M and EPS of -$0.59 to -$0.62, below a consensus of $150.3M and -$0.58. No explanation is given for either forecast.
    • Q2 billings totaled $42M (+24% Y/Y), above revenue of $35.2M. Free cash flow was -$1.7M, better than a net loss of $9.5M.
    • Jive faces competition in the enterprise social networking software space from IBM, SAP, Salesforce (Chatter), and Microsoft (Yammer).
    • CC at 5PM ET (webcast)
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor beats on EPS, beats on revenue

    • Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q2 EPS of $1.35 beats by $0.35.
    • Revenue of $196.1M beats by $27M. (PR)
    • Shares +10.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 6 Comments
  • FTNT

    Fortinet EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q2 EPS of $0.10 in-line.
    • Revenue of $147.4M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $4.7M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Renewable Energy Group (NASDAQ:REGI): Q2 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $387M (+42.4% Y/Y) beats by $86M.
    • Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • MTGE

    More on American Capital Mortgage earnings

    • $5.05 per share net loss from marks on agency MBS, offset by $3.68 in gains on hedges.
    • $1.05 per share of spread and TBA dollar roll income
    • Undistributed estimated taxable income of $0.43/share down $0.02 from Q1.
    • Book value off 6.7% to $22.63; todays close of $19.42 has shares at 14.2% discount
    • $8.8B investment portfolio consists of $7.8B in agency MBS, $931M in non-agency; $91M net long TBA position; portfolio size on March 31 was $11.8B.
    • Leverage of 6.4x
    • Average net interest spread of 2.3%, quarter-end spread of 1.96%; vs. 2.27% and 1.9% in Q1.
    • 2.9M shares repurchased (4.9% of float) at average of $21.34 each.
    • Earlier: Earnings report.
    • MTGE shares +1.4% AH after climbing 5.7% in the regular session behind American Capital Agency's big move.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMGN

    Amgen Q2 beats across the board

    • Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN): Q2 EPS of $1.89 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $4.68B (+4% Y/Y) beats by $190M. (PR)
    • Shares +2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $73.7M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $1.83M. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • MAKO

    More on Mako Surgical's Q2 results

    • The number of MAKOplasty procedures performed in Q2 rises 26% Y/Y and 10% sequentially.
    • 10 RIO systems were sold in Q2 versus five in Q1.
    • Outlook is unchanged at 45-48 RIO systems sold and 13,500-14,500 MAKOplasty procedures performed. MAKO +8.16% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • BWLD

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings' Q2

    • Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) reports same-store sales rose 3.8% during the quarter at company-owned restaurants to miss the estimate of analysts.
    • Cost of sales were up only 16.8% (compared to 28% revenue growth) with the cost of chicken wings lower during the period.
    • Franchise royalties and fees up 7.9% Y/Y.
    • The company says it's comping over last year's same-store sales mark of 6.8% for the first four weeks of the quarter. (PR)
    • BWLD -1.8% AH as the EPS and sales beat are overshadowed by the tepid comp store sales rate.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO): FQ1 EPS of -$0.54 beats by $0.04.
    • Non-GAAP Revenue of $144.3M beats by $12.97M. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical EPS, revenue miss estimates

    • Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) Q2: EPS  -$0.42 misses by $0.21.
    • Revenue of $28.2M (+19% Y/Y) misses by $0.65M.
    • 3,274 MAKOplasty procedures performed during the period. Shares +5.93% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed EPS in-line, revenue misses

    • Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q2 EPS of $0.22 in-line.
    • Revenue of $254.8M (+28% Y/Y) misses by $2.9M.
    • Shares -9.3% AH.
    • CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast), guidance should be provided. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYMC

    Symantec beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC): FQ1 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $1.71B (+2% Y/Y) beats by $0.07B. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings beats by $0.09, beats on revenue

    • Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q2 EPS of $0.88 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $305M (+27.8% Y/Y) beats by $0.76M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOV

    National Oilwell says tight delivery schedules hitting margins

    • National Oilwell Varco (NOV -2.4%) says more demanding delivery schedules for its rig technology are driving up staff and freight costs, eating into margins at its unit which generated more than 50% of Q2 revenues. (Q2 results)
    • In the earnings call, COO Clay Williams pointed to shaving 10-12 months off its delivery schedule: "Extraordinary efforts to hit delivery targets are driving higher freight and personnel costs."
    • Margins in the rig technology business have dropped six quarters in a row, and fell to 20.7% in Q2 from 23.7% a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Facebook reportedly planning TV-style commericals

    • Facebook (FB +6.8%) plans to sell 15 second long TV-type ads on its site for as much as $2.5M per day, reports Bloomberg.
    • Back of the envelope: $2.5M times 365 days equals nearly $1B per year (company earned about $330M on revenue of $1.8B last quarter).
    • Already having a big day in continuation of a massive post-earnings move, the stock is within pennies of its $38 IPO price.
    • Previous: Facebook launches mobile game publishing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • OXY

    Occidental hints at spinoff of California operations

    • Occidental Petroleum (OXY -2.3%) offered extensive details on its California operations during its earnings call, feeding speculation it may spin off that unit, which regularly faces tougher government scrutiny than elsewhere.
    • "We want to make sure that the California company has stable, solid cash flow going forward," CEO Steve Chazen says.
    • Expects H2 U.S. oil production of 6K-8K bbl/day higher than H1 average; sees Q2's "modest declines" in domestic gas and NGLs production to continue due to reduced drilling on gas properties and natural decline. (slides)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • RYL

    UBS upgrades Ryland to Buy

    • Ryland Group (RYL +0.9%) gets a boost as UBS analyst David Goldberg upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral, and raises his price target to $48 from $39.
    • Goldberg says the recent decline is overdone. The stock now trades at 1.8x times book value, offering what he calls an "attractive buying opportunity."
    • The recent decline in the home builders reflects concerns over rising rates, he notes, combined with limited visibility given seasonal patterns. This should only have a limited impact from rising rates over the next 12-18 months.
    • Longer term, as the recovery spreads to more peripheral areas, declining affordability should generate more moderate growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • CAB

    Cabela's gets a boost from Cramer

    • Cabela's (CAB +2.2%) trades higher following a bullish call from Jim Cramer on last night's episode of Mad Money. "For guns, I'm going to own CAB," Cramer said.
    • The stock is up nearly 3% since the company reported Q2 earnings last week (comps growth came in at 10.5% for the quarter) and has benefited recently from a couple of bullish write-ups from CNBC and Businessweek.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy added to Focus List at Credit Suisse

    • MarkWest Energy (MWE +2.8%) shares outpace most energy issues today after Credit Suisse adds the MLP to its Focus List and raises its price target to $83 from $73.
    • MWE's ~1.6B cf/day of processing and 60K bbl/day of fractionation capacity in the Marcellus is expanding to ~3.3B cf/day and 175K bbl/day by year-end 2014, the firm says; it's even better in the Utica, where processing capacity moves from 185M cf/day to nearly 1B cf/day and fractionation will reach 100K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • NTR

    Potash turmoil to hit Canada's economy

    • Canada's investors and economy will feel the sting from the potash bombshell out of Russia, at least in the short term, CIBC's chief economist says.
    • Potash production in Canada accounts for 0.5% of GDP and ~1.5% of Canadian exports; a drop of 25% in volumes this quarter - not unreasonable, as buyers wait and see how low prices go - would mean a 0.4% annualized drop in Q3 GDP. (EWC -1.2%)
    • Potash (POT -16.6%) shares already were facing pressure from weakening prices, leading it to cut its earnings outlook just last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARQL

    ArQule Q2 beats across the board on reduced costs

    • ArQule (ARQL +1.4%) after its Q2 report beat across the board as losses were mitigated by reduced operational costs and personnel reductions.
    • R&D costs declined Y/Y, due to lower outsourced clinical and product development costs related to Phase 1 and Phase 2 programs for tivantinib and pipeline programs, as well as reduced labor-related costs.
    • Looking forward, the company sees FY2013 sales of between $12M - 15M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin spikes as Alexion enlists Goldman for Roche deal

    • In a replay of what happened when the Alexion/ Roche rumors first started flying, shares of BioMarin (BMRN +3%) rally on news Alexion has hired Goldman to advise on a possible buyout offer.
    • REGN also shot higher around the time the ALXN news broke.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • FGP

    No fatalities after Florida propane plant explosion

    • All workers at a Ferrellgas (FGP -2%) propane gas plant in Florida rocked by massive explosions last night are accounted for after officials initially reported more than a dozen employees missing.
    • The cause of the incident is under investigation, FGP says.
    • The Blue Rhino plant is one of nine propane exchange plants FGP operates; it usually has 53K 20-pound (9-kg) propane tanks.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • HRS

    Harris Corporation guides above estimates, shares jump

    • Shares of Harris Corporation (HRS +7.4%) are up handily following the company's FQ4 report.
    • CEO William Brown calls the quarter "solid in a tough government spending environment." Results were helped in part by the quick implementation of restructuring efforts announced in April.
    • Revenue growth by segment: RF Communications, -14.2%; Integrated Network Solutions, +6%; Government Communications Systems, -3%.
    • FY14 EPS outlook: $4.65-4.85 versus consensus of $4.62. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • LKM

    New highs for NQ Mobile following China Mobile deal

    • NQ Mobile (NQ +7.1%) shares have gradually surged after announcing its FL Mobile social networking/gaming unit has become a game provider for China Mobile's Game Center app store.
    • NQ already has a major security software partnership with China Mobile (the world's biggest carrier in terms of subs). Its NationSky mobile device management software unit also has a deal with the carrier.
    • Along with the announcement, NQ mentions FL Mobile now has 13.7M monthly active users, and is seeing 10M downloads/month for its titles.
    • Shares now +148% YTD, aided by a Q2 pre-announcement. Full Q2 results arrive on Aug. 12.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • CAS

    A.M. Castle moves up on a mixed Q2 report but signs of life in its restructuring

    • AM Castle (CAS +8.2%) climbs after reporting a Q2 that missed on revenue but beat on a per share basis as cash flows improved and the company reaped cost savings from its restructuring.
    • CEO Scott Dolan said in its statement that, in terms of market demand, its outlook for H2 is comparable to what it's seen in the first six months of the year.
    • Net sales in its metals segment declined 20.7% Y/Y, 10.2% Q/Q.
    • Plastics sales rose 5.6% Y/Y, but declined 1.1% Q/Q.
    • Gross material margins were 26.3%, compared to 25.0% in Q1 and 26.9% in the same quarter last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • CVLT

    CommVault soars on FQ1 beat, outlook; rival Symantec set to report

    • CommVault (CVLT +10.3%) is back near its all-time highs after providing FQ1 results and CC remarks that suggest its storage backup/recovery software share gains aren't slowing down.
    • CEO Neil Hammer mentioned on the CC "there could be upside" to FY14 estimates on account of a strong deal pipeline and share gains, and healthy interest in the recently-announced Simpana 10 (the latest version of CommVault's flagship backup/restore suite). But he added U.S. federal and European IT spending issues make current estimates "reasonable."
    • The FQ1 beat was fueled in part by spending controls and lower-than-expected employee growth (+57 Q/Q). That, in turn, helped EBIT margin grow 30 bps Q/Q and 300 bps Y/Y to 38%.
    • Deferred revenue totaled $189.2M at quarter's end, +3% Q/Q and +31% Y/Y.
    • Symantec (SYMC +1.7%), which CommVault has taken some share from, is up moderately ahead of today's FQ1 report. Shares +31% YTD on optimism about new CEO Steve Bennett's efforts to cut costs, return cash, and deliver more integrated software solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • BHP

    Potash cartel breakup may signal end to BHP's $15B mine plan

    • The breakup of the Russian potash marketing cartel may signal the death knell for plans by BHP Billiton (BHP -1.8%) to spend as much as $15B to expand into production of the fertilizer ingredient.
    • While BHP has said it sees potash becoming the fifth pillar of its business in addition to copper, iron ore, coal and oil, it has delayed a final investment decision amid a freeze on new projects amid waning demand for raw materials.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALXN

    Alexion asks Goldman to advise on potential Roche deal

    • Shares of Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +6.8%) move sharply to the upside on reports the company has hired Goldman to advise on any future overtures from Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -0.8%).
    • Roche would like to have Soliris of course, but the company is also interested in ALXN's pipeline, sources tell Bloomberg.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • LECO

    Lincoln Electric posts a solid Q2, Stifel raises PTto $68

    • Lincoln Electric (LECO +2.2%) gains despite posting a mixed Q2, missing on revenue but beating on a per share basis.
    • Looking forward, CEO Christopher Mapes says the company is maintaining a cautious outlook for the balance of the year on mixed end sector performance, but expects post solid margin and earnings performance, fueled by its new initiatives, product introductions and the careful management of expenses.
    • Stifel Nicolaus raises its price target to $68 on the back of the report, noting that LECO reported another strong quarter with significant margin expansion despite softer revenues.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • AUDC

    Rivals AudioCodes, Sonus go in opposite directions following Q2 reports

    • AudioCodes (AUDC +8.7%) is soaring after beating Q2 estimates and guiding on its CC for 2013 revenue of $135M-$137M and EPS of $0.12-$0.15 (mostly above a consensus of $135M and $0.12).
    • Whereas VoIP infrastructure hardware/software rival Sonus (SONS -6.2%) is giving back some of its big 2013 gains in spite of beating estimates, issuing strong guidance, and announcing a $100M buyback. Concerns about the departures of Sonus' CFO and services chief could be weighing.
    • Two other possible issues: Analysts questioned Sonus on its CC about a relatively high services revenue mix, and the company mentioned Q2 book-to-bill was slightly below 1.
    • SA contributor Josh Franklin, who has been bullish on AudioCodes for some time, notes the company is seeing strong demand for products used in Microsoft Lync deployments, and predicts institutional ownership is set to grow.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • XYL

    Xylem sinks as earnings, revenue, guidance come up short

    • Shares of Xylem (XYL -11.3%) fall hard as the company says adjusted EPS decreased 26% Y/Y in Q2. Organic revenue growth came in at -3.4% for the period.
    • Weakness in Europe "more than offset" strength in U.S. residential, commercial, and agricultural businesses.
    • Outlook is "adjusted to reflect on-going market weakness." Management now sees FY13 EPS of $1.40-1.50 on revenue of $3.7B. Consensus is $1.82/ share on $3.87B in sales. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming soars after steady earnings report

    • The acquisition of Peninsula Gaming helped Boyd Gaming (BYD +16.7%) improve revenue and profit significantly from last year's second quarter.
    • Growth at Las Vegas properties outpaced Borgata in Atlantic City and casinos in the Midwest.
    • Shares of BYD trade at a two-month high as the heavy short interest gets flushed out.
    • earnings, conference call webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals moves up after posting Q2 earnings, pipeline update

    • Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +4.8%) trades up today despite the Q2 earnings miss.
    • The company also reported on progress in its clinical pipeline, saying it's completed the pioneer portion of a Phase 2 clinical trial of LX4211 for the treatment of type 1 diabetes, with the drug showing a favorable safety profile when given in combination with insulin.
    • It's also initiated enrollment of patients in the expansion portion of the type 1 diabetes trial and is proceeding with preparations for the initiation of Phase 3 clinical trials of LX4211 in type 2 diabetes as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • BID

    Sotheby's on the move after Marcato Capital discloses a stake

    • Shares of Sotheby's (BID +4.2%) shoots higher after Marcato Capital discloses a 6.61% position in the companyu.
    • SEC 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon jumps on Peregrine Semi numbers, Apple speculation

    • Rubicon (RBCN +8.9%) sapphire wafer customer Peregrine Semi (PSMI +13.5%) posted a strong Q2 beat yesterday afternoon on the back of growing RF switch sales to smartphone OEMs.
    • Sapphire equipment vendor GT Advanced (GTAT +6.3%) is also rallying.
    • Peregrine's Q3 guidance is only in-line (revenue of $58M-$62M vs. $60.6M consensus), but expectations have been low.
    • Peregrine mentioned on its Q2 CC ramping 4G smartphone sales are growing its addressable market, and asserted the increasing RF complexity of 4G phones (thanks to the need to support numerous bands and carrier aggregation) works in its favor.
    • Sterne Agee is upbeat about the implications of Peregrine's numbers for Rubicon, and also provides fresh speculation about Apple's potential use of sapphire cover glass.
    • Rubicon and GT Advanced's gains come in spite of an underwhelming Q2 update from Veeco.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • ROK

    Rockwell Automation's profit jumps, shares rise

    • Shares of Rockwell Automation (ROK +5.2%) are higher on the session after the company's FQ3 profit rises 12% Y/Y, beating estimates.
    • Operating margin increases 90 bps for the period on "volume leverage."
    • CEO Keith Nosbusch is "very pleased" with organic sales growth of 4% and says "market conditions [should] remain stable through Q4."

    India sinks on hawkish RBI comments
